isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - GENERAL PROCEDURES - INSTALL TIGHT FIT YOKES

svcproc.title: INSTALL TIGHT FIT YOKES
svcproc.para: A three-piece installation tool is required to correctly install yokes with interference fit splines ( Figure 51). The installation tool is available from P.D.C. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Install Pilot Shaft on Input Shaft

caution.para: Do not install tight fit yokes on shafts using a hammer or mallet. A hammer or mallet will damage the yoke and/or bearing.

step1.para: Apply axle lubricant on the yoke seal.
Check all surfaces of the yoke hub for damage. If necessary, polish the yoke hub with an India stone, emery cloth or crocus cloth.
Install the pilot shaft on the input shaft of the assembly ( Figure 51).
Slide the yoke over the pilot shaft. Align the yoke splines with the shaft splines.
Put the collar on the pilot shaft and slide it against the yoke.

Install the nut on the pilot shaft and against the collar. Tighten the nut against collar until the yoke is completely in position on the shaft. Sometimes a torque value of 200 ft-lbs. on the nut is required to install the yoke correctly.

caution.para: Do not use the assembly yoke nut for installation purposes. Use the nut that is supplied with the three-piece pilot tool.

step1.para: Remove all parts of the pilot tool from the shaft (pilot shaft, collar and nut).
Install the washer (if required) and yoke nut on the shaft. Tighten the nut to the required torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
